member.name: T:Bing.BingClientBase
member.summary: The base for all Bing REST Clients in this library. Handles setting the UserAgent.

member.name: M:Bing.BingClientBase.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the API Key and the UserAgent for the implemented Bing Clients.
member.param: The key registered to a given user to access the Bing APIs.

member.name: T:Bing.Core.AddressBase
member.summary: Details about a point on the Earth that has additional location information.

member.name: P:Bing.Core.AddressBase.AddressLine
member.summary: The official street line of an address relative to the area, as specified by the Locality, or PostalCode, properties.
member.remarks: Typical use of this element would be to provide a street address or any official address.

member.name: P:Bing.Core.AddressBase.Locality
member.summary: A string specifying the populated place for the address.
member.remarks: This typically refers to a city, but may refer to a suburb or a neighborhood in certain countries.

member.name: P:Bing.Core.AddressBase.AdminDistrict
member.summary: A string specifying the subdivision name in the country or region for an address.
member.remarks: This element is typically treated as the first order administrative subdivision, but in some cases it is the second, third, or fourth order subdivision in a country, dependency, or region.

member.name: P:Bing.Core.AddressBase.AdminDistrict2
member.summary: A string specifying the subdivision name in the country or region for an address.
member.remarks: This element is used when there is another level of subdivision information for a location, such as the county.

member.name: P:Bing.Core.AddressBase.PostalCode
member.summary: A string specifying the post code, postal code, or ZIP Code of an address.

member.name: P:Bing.Core.AddressBase.CountryRegion
member.summary: A string specifying the country or region name of an address.

member.name: T:Bing.MapsClient
member.summary: The Bing™ Maps REST Services Application Programming Interface (API) provides a Representational State Transfer (REST) interface to perform tasks such as creating a static map with pushpins, geocoding an address, retrieving imagery metadata, or creating a route.

member.name: M:Bing.MapsClient.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Bing.Maps.UserContext)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the MapsClient.
member.param: The key registered to a given user to access the Bing APIs.
The culture code that map data should be localized to. Supported culture codes are listed here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh441729.aspx.
A object containing information about the user to refine location results.

member.name: M:Bing.MapsClient.CompressPoints(System.Collections.Generic.List{Bing.Maps.Point})
member.summary: Implements the Point Compression Algorithm specified at http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj158958.aspx
member.param: A List of Points to compress.

member.name: M:Bing.MapsClient.LocationQuery(Bing.Maps.Address,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get a location by specifying values such as a locality, postal code, and street address.
member.param: Specifies the maximum number of locations to return in the response.
Specifies to include the neighborhood in the response when it is available.
member.returns: A object with the results from Bing.

member.name: M:Bing.MapsClient.LocationQuery(Bing.Maps.Point,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get an location for a specified point (latitude and longitude).
member.param: The coordinates of the location that you want to query.
Specifies to include the neighborhood in the response when it is available.
member.returns: A object with the results from Bing.

member.name: M:Bing.MapsClient.LocationQuery(System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get an address for a specified point (latitude and longitude).
member.param: The N-S coordinate for the point in question.
The E-W coordinate for the point in question.
Specifies to include the neighborhood in the response when it is available.
member.returns: A object with the results from Bing.

member.name: M:Bing.MapsClient.LocationQuery(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get location(s) for a given search term.
member.param: A string that contains information about a location, such as an address or landmark name.
Specifies the maximum number of locations to return in the response.
Specifies to include the neighborhood in the response when it is available.
member.returns: A object with the results from Bing.
member.remarks: The strings "Space Needle" (a landmark) and "1 Microsoft Way Redmond WA" (an address) are examples of query strings with location information.

member.name: P:Bing.MapsClient.Culture
member.summary: For supported cultures, street names are localized to the local culture. For example, if you request a location in France, the street names are localized in French. For other localized data such as country names, the level of localization will vary for each culture. For example, there may not be a localized name for the "United States" for every culture code.

member.name: P:Bing.MapsClient.UserContext
member.summary: Use user context parameters to specify information about the user. You can increase the accuracy of a location result when you specify a user context parameter in your request URL.

member.name: T:Bing.Maps.UserContext
member.summary: Used to provide more accurate results based on the user's locations Typically only one of the properties will be set

member.name: M:Bing.Maps.UserContext.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The IPv4 address to search near.

member.name: M:Bing.Maps.UserContext.#ctor(Bing.Core.BoundingBox)
member.param: A rectangular area on the earth defined as a bounding box object.

member.name: M:Bing.Maps.UserContext.#ctor(System.String,Bing.Maps.Point,Bing.Core.BoundingBox)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: The user's ip address
The user's location
A rectangular area on the earth defined as a bounding box object.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.UserContext.IpAddress
member.summary: The default address is the IPv4 address of the request.
member.remarks: When you specify this parameter, the location associated with the IP address is taken into account in computing the results of a location query.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.UserContext.Location
member.summary: A point on the earth specified as a latitude and longitude.
member.remarks: When you specify this parameter, the user’s location is taken into account and the results returned may be more relevant to the user.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.UserContext.MapView
member.summary: A point on the earth specified as a latitude and longitude.
member.remarks: When you specify this parameter, the geographical area is taken into account when computing the results of a location query.

member.name: T:Bing.Maps.Address
member.summary: Details about a point on the Earth that has additional location information.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Address.FormattedAddress
member.summary: A string specifying the complete address. This address may not include the country or region.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Address.Neighborhood
member.summary: A string specifying the neighborhood for an address.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Address.Landmark
member.summary: A string specifying the name of the landmark when there is a landmark associated with an address.

member.name: T:Bing.Core.BoundingBox
member.summary: A bounding box is defined by two latitudes and two longitudes that represent the four sides of a rectangular area on the Earth.

member.name: M:Bing.Core.BoundingBox.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor.

member.name: M:Bing.Core.BoundingBox.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a BoundingBox with the coordinates in the order they are specified in Bing queries (SWNE).
member.param: The southern-most edge of the box.
The western-most edge of the box.
The northern-most edge of the box.
The eastern-most edge of the box.

member.name: M:Bing.Core.BoundingBox.ToString
member.summary: Outputs a BoundingBox with the coordinates in the order they are specified in Bing queries (SWNE).

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Location.Name
member.summary: The name of the resource.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Location.Point
member.summary: The latitude and longitude coordinates of the location.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Location.EntityType
member.summary: The classification of the geographic entity returned, such as Address.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Location.Address
member.summary: The postal address for the location. An address can contain AddressLine, Neighborhood, Locality, AdminDistrict, AdminDistrict2, CountryRegion, FormattedAddress, PostalCode, and Landmark fields.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Location.Confidence
member.summary: The level of confidence that the geocoded location result is a match. Use this value with the match code to determine for more complete information about the match.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Location.MatchCodes
member.summary: The level of confidence that the geocoded location result is a match. Use this value with the match code to determine for more complete information about the match.
member.remarks:
For example, a geocoded location with match codes of Good and Ambiguous means that more than one geocode location was found for the location information and that the geocode service did not have search up-hierarchy to find a match.
Similarly, a geocoded location with match codes of Ambiguous and UpHierarchy means that a geocode location could not be found that matched all of the location information, so the geocode service had to search up-hierarchy and found multiple matches at that level. An example of up an Ambiguous and UpHierarchy result is when you provide complete address information, but the geocode service cannot locate a match for the street address and instead returns information for more than one RoadBlock value.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Location.GeocodePoints
member.summary: A collection of geocoded points that differ in how they were calculated and their suggested use.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Point.Coordinates
member.summary: The latitude and longitude coordinates of the geocode point.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Point.CalculationMethod
member.summary: The method that was used to compute the geocode point.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.Point.UsageTypes
member.summary: The best use for the geocode point.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.ResourceSet`1.EstimatedTotal
member.summary: An estimate of the total number of resources in the ResourceSet.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.ResourceSet`1.Resources
member.summary: A collection of one or more resources. The resources that are returned depend on the request. Information about resources is provided in the API reference for each Bing Maps REST Services API.

member.name: T:Bing.Maps.MapsResponse`1
member.summary: The response to a Bing Maps REST Services URL request includes the status of the request and one or more resources that contain location, imagery, or route information. The resource information that is returned depends on the Bing Maps REST Services URL that is used and the parameter values that are provided with it. For example, a Locations API URL returns one or more Location resources that provide location information based on the values in the URL request.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.MapsResponse`1.Copyright
member.summary: A copyright notice.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.MapsResponse`1.BrandLogoUri
member.summary: A URL that references a brand image to support contractual branding requirements.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.MapsResponse`1.StatusCode
member.summary: The HTTP Status code for the request.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.MapsResponse`1.StatusDescription
member.summary: A description of the HTTP status code.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.MapsResponse`1.AuthenticationResultCode
member.summary: A status code that offers additional information about authentication success or failure.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.MapsResponse`1.ErrorDetails
member.summary: A collection of error descriptions. For example, ErrorDetails can identify parameter values that are not valid or missing.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.MapsResponse`1.TraceId
member.summary: A unique identifier for the request.

member.name: P:Bing.Maps.MapsResponse`1.ResourceSets
member.summary: A collection of ResourceSet objects. A ResourceSet is a container of Resources returned by the request.

member.name: T:Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityGroups
member.summary: Common groups of related Points of Interest.
member.remarks: These were determined by AdvancedREI, not Bing.

member.name: M:Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityGroups.BuildFilter(System.Collections.Generic.List{Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityTypes})
member.summary: Converts a list of PoiEntityTypes to the format the Bing API requires.
member.param: The list of Points of Interest to search for.
member.returns: An Odata-formatted filter clause that can be passed to the Find() method.

member.name: M:Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityGroups.Education
member.summary: A list of all entities typically associated with Education.

member.name: M:Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityGroups.Schools
member.summary: A list of K-12 and Colleges.

member.name: M:Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityGroups.Financial
member.summary: Gets a list of all financial services entities.
member.returns: A List of PoiEntityTypes that represent financial services entities.

member.name: M:Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityGroups.BanksAndATMs
member.summary: Gets a list of all institutional financial services entities.
member.returns: A List of PoiEntityTypes that represent institutional financial services entities.

member.name: M:Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityGroups.OtherFinancialServices
member.summary: Gets a list of all other non-banking financial services.
member.returns: A List of PoiEntityTypes that represent all other non-banking financial services.

member.name: M:Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityGroups.Tourism
member.summary: Gets a list of all vehicle parking facilities.
member.returns: A List of PoiEntityTypes that represent vehicle parking facilities.

member.name: M:Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityGroups.Parking
member.summary: Gets a list of all vehicle parking facilities.
member.returns: A List of PoiEntityTypes that represent vehicle parking facilities.

member.name: M:Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityGroups.PublicTransportation
member.summary: Gets a list of all public transportation entities.
member.returns: A List of PoiEntityTypes that represent public transportation entities.

member.name: M:Bing.Spatial.PoiEntityGroups.Transportation
member.summary: Gets a list of all possible transportation-related entities.
member.returns: A List of PoiEntityTypes that represent transportation-related entities.
